BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The danger of wet avalanches will already increase in the late morning.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of wet avalanches being released will increase quickly. This applies on steep sunny slopes in all altitude zones, as well as on steep, rather lightly snow-covered shady slopes below approximately 2600 m.
On steep grassy slopes more medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large gliding avalanches are possible below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.

In isolated cases wet avalanches can also release the saturated snowpack and reach large size. In steep gullies the avalanches can in isolated cases reach valley bottoms at relatively high altitudes. Backcountry tours and ascents to alpine cabins should be started and concluded very early.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The weather will be very warm. The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust only at high altitudes and will already soften in the late morning. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from late morning to a loss of strength within the snowpack. In areas with a thinner snowpack the saturation and consequently the loss of strength happens more rapidly
The snowpack will be wet all the way through below approximately 2400 m. Hardly any snow is lying at low and intermediate altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be exceptionally warm. The summery weather conditions will give rise to rapid and thorough wetting of the snowpack at elevated altitudes.

As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of wet avalanches being released will increase quickly. This applies on steep sunny slopes in all altitude zones, as well as on steep, rather lightly snow-covered shady slopes below approximately 2600 m.
On steep grassy slopes more medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large gliding avalanches are possible below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.

In isolated cases wet avalanches can also release the saturated snowpack and reach large size. In steep gullies the avalanches can in isolated cases reach valley bottoms at relatively high altitudes. Backcountry tours and ascents to alpine cabins should be started and concluded very early.

The weather will be very warm. The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust only at high altitudes and will already soften in the late morning. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from late morning to a loss of strength within the snowpack. In areas with a thinner snowpack the saturation and consequently the loss of strength happens more rapidly
The snowpack will be wet all the way through below approximately 2400 m. Hardly any snow is lying at low and intermediate altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be exceptionally warm. The summery weather conditions will give rise to rapid and thorough wetting of the snowpack at elevated altitudes.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of moist and wet avalanches being released will increase quickly in particular on very steep sunny slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation wet and gliding avalanches are possible from the late morning. In the event of solar radiation this applies in particular on very steep slopes. Occasionally large natural avalanches are possible especially on rocky sunny slopes.
The new snow and wind slabs can be released in some cases at intermediate and high altitudes. The dry avalanches can as before reach medium size.

Backcountry tours, off-piste skiing and ascents to alpine cabins should be started and concluded very early.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The snowpack consists of rounded crystals. This applies in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will already be soft in the early morning. In the last few days numerous small and medium-sized avalanches were observed.

At intermediate and high altitudes there is more snow than usual.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be very mild.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of moist and wet avalanches being released will increase quickly in particular on very steep sunny slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation wet and gliding avalanches are possible from the late morning. In the event of solar radiation this applies in particular on very steep slopes. Occasionally large natural avalanches are possible especially on rocky sunny slopes.
The new snow and wind slabs can be released in some cases at intermediate and high altitudes. The dry avalanches can as before reach medium size.

Backcountry tours, off-piste skiing and ascents to alpine cabins should be started and concluded very early.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The snowpack consists of rounded crystals. This applies in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will already be soft in the early morning. In the last few days numerous small and medium-sized avalanches were observed.

At intermediate and high altitudes there is more snow than usual.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be very mild.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The weather will be mild. As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent from the late morning.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The weather will be mild. As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the activity of small and medium moist avalanches has gradually increased. This applies in particular on very steep slopes above approximately 2000 m, as well as at the base of rock walls. In addition from the late morning in all aspects, an increasing number of medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large wet avalanches are possible. In particular on shady slopes the avalanches can penetrate even deep layers. The clearly visible wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence in all aspects at high altitude. Backcountry tourers or freeriders can release avalanches easily.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The surface of the snowpack will soften during the day. As a consequence of warming during the day the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent as the day progresses. The new snow of Wednesday must be evaluated with care and prudence in all aspects above approximately 2700 m. The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust only at high altitudes and will soften during the day.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Significant warming: Backcountry tours and ascents to alpine cabins should be started and concluded early. Wet snow represents the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The weather will be very warm. The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from early morning to rapid softening of the snowpack over a wide area.
In the late morning the likelihood of moist and wet avalanches being released will increase in particular on rocky sunny slopes below approximately 3600 m. Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.
In starting zones where no previous releases have taken place and at intermediate and high altitudes medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large wet avalanches are possible as the day progresses as a consequence of solar radiation. These can also be released in near-ground layers.
As a consequence of wind from northeasterly directions, mostly small wind slabs formed on Wednesday in some localities. These avalanche prone locations are to be found especially on near-ridge shady slopes above approximately 3200 m. They are clearly recognisable to the trained eye.
Individual gliding avalanches can also occur. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided as far as possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Friday: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night was quite good over a wide area.

Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise from late morning to rapid moistening of the snowpack in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 3200 m. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to rapid settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
Above approximately 2200 m a lot of snow is lying.
In the last few days numerous small to medium-sized avalanches were reported.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be very warm. These meteorological conditions will prevent a change towards better conditions in the early morning. The danger of moist and wet avalanches will already exist in the early morning.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Significant warming: Backcountry tours and ascents to alpine cabins should be started and concluded early. Wet snow represents the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The weather will be very warm. The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from early morning to rapid softening of the snowpack over a wide area.
In the late morning the likelihood of moist and wet avalanches being released will increase in particular on rocky sunny slopes below approximately 3600 m. Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.
In starting zones where no previous releases have taken place and at intermediate and high altitudes medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large wet avalanches are possible as the day progresses as a consequence of solar radiation. These can also be released in near-ground layers.
As a consequence of wind from northeasterly directions, mostly small wind slabs formed on Wednesday in some localities. These avalanche prone locations are to be found especially on near-ridge shady slopes above approximately 3200 m. They are clearly recognisable to the trained eye.
Individual gliding avalanches can also occur. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided as far as possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Friday: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night was quite good over a wide area.

Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise from late morning to rapid moistening of the snowpack in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 3200 m. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to rapid settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
Above approximately 2200 m a lot of snow is lying.
In the last few days numerous small to medium-sized avalanches were reported.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be very warm. These meteorological conditions will prevent a change towards better conditions in the early morning. The danger of moist and wet avalanches will already exist in the early morning.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs and wet snow represent the main danger. The avalanche danger will already increase in the late morning.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are to be expected from the late morning. Medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large natural avalanches are possible in particular on steep sunny slopes. Low altitudes: On very steep grassy slopes these can slide on the ground.
As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed in the last few days in high Alpine regions. Wind slabs can be released and reach medium size.

Off-piste activities call for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and careful route selection. Backcountry tours should be started and concluded very early.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will already be soft in the early morning. In the last few days numerous small and medium-sized avalanches were observed.
The spring-like weather conditions will give rise to increasing settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.

At intermediate and high altitudes a very large amount of snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be very mild.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs and wet snow represent the main danger. The avalanche danger will already increase in the late morning.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are to be expected from the late morning. Medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large natural avalanches are possible in particular on steep sunny slopes. Low altitudes: On very steep grassy slopes these can slide on the ground.
As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed in the last few days in high Alpine regions. Wind slabs can be released and reach medium size.

Off-piste activities call for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and careful route selection. Backcountry tours should be started and concluded very early.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will already be soft in the early morning. In the last few days numerous small and medium-sized avalanches were observed.
The spring-like weather conditions will give rise to increasing settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.

At intermediate and high altitudes a very large amount of snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be very mild.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The sometimes large wind slabs of the last few days can still be released in some cases in particular on wind-protected shady slopes above approximately 2800 m.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good. As the day progresses as a consequence of warming during the day there will be an increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches. Below approximately 2800 m medium-sized to large wet loose snow avalanches are possible. In particular in gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain sometimes large wind slabs formed.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Towards its surface, the snowpack is moist and its surface has a strong crust. As the day progresses as a consequence of warming during the day there will be an increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches. In particular adjacent to ridgelines as well as at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The weather conditions will bring about a substantial rise in the avalanche danger in the late morning.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Significant increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day. Avalanches are possible from the late morning, but they can be large in isolated cases. In the event of solar radiation this applies in particular on rocky slopes.
The wind slabs of the last few days can still be released and generally at elevated altitudes. Dry slab avalanches are possible, even medium-sized ones.
Backcountry tours, off-piste skiing and ascents to alpine cabins should be started and concluded early.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The snowpack consists of rounded crystals. This applies in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will already be soft in the early morning. The spring-like weather conditions will give rise to rapid settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.

In particular at intermediate and high altitudes there is still a very large amount of snow.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be very mild.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The weather conditions will bring about a substantial rise in the avalanche danger in the late morning.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Significant increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day. Avalanches are possible from the late morning, but they can be large in isolated cases. In the event of solar radiation this applies in particular on rocky slopes.
The wind slabs of the last few days can still be released and generally at elevated altitudes. Dry slab avalanches are possible, even medium-sized ones.
Backcountry tours, off-piste skiing and ascents to alpine cabins should be started and concluded early.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The snowpack consists of rounded crystals. This applies in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will already be soft in the early morning. The spring-like weather conditions will give rise to rapid settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.

In particular at intermediate and high altitudes there is still a very large amount of snow.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be very mild.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The prevalence of the avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses. Backcountry tours should be started and concluded early. In many places there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface. In the event of a clear night this applies in particular in the early morning.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of moist and wet avalanches being released will increase in all aspects. The avalanche prone locations are to be found at the base of rock walls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. Gliding avalanches can also occur, in particular on steep grassy slopes.
The wind slabs remain for the foreseeable future prone to triggering, especially adjacent to ridgelines. In all regions medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large avalanches are possible.
Avalanches can be released, mostly by large loads.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The weather conditions gave rise to thorough wetting of the snowpack over a wide area.
Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good. The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust and will soften during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Further warming. The weather will be exceptionally warm.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The weather will be very mild. Wet and gliding snow require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation small to medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible above approximately 1700 m. In particular on shady slopes the avalanches can penetrate even deep layers. Weakly bonded old snow and wet snow require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The snowpack will be generally moist. The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will already be soft in the early morning.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation numerous medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large wet avalanches are possible as the day progresses.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Moist and wet avalanches and gliding avalanches and wet snow slides are to be expected in particular during the day.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The weather will be very warm. The danger of wet avalanches will increase during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the activity of wet avalanches will gradually increase. On steep grassy slopes mostly small gliding avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The surface of the snowpack will freeze very little and will already be soft in the early morning.

Below approximately 1800 m from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Conditions are favorable concerning avalanche hazard.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wet snow slides and avalanches are possible in isolated cases. Mostly these are small.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Above approximately 2000 m: In gullies and bowls mostly small wet snow slides and avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Below approximately 1900 m hardly any snow is lying. The old snowpack will be subject to considerable local variations. The older wind slabs are to be found especially in gullies and bowls and at high altitudes. The snowpack will be generally moist.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The weather will be very warm. The danger of wet avalanches will increase during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the activity of wet avalanches will gradually increase. On steep grassy slopes mostly small gliding avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The surface of the snowpack will freeze very little and will already be soft in the early morning.

Below approximately 1800 m from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Conditions are favorable concerning avalanche hazard.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The weather will be mostly sunny.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on shady slopes at elevated altitudes. Mostly small avalanches are possible in particular on steep shady slopes. Avalanches can be released, mostly by large loads in isolated cases.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be good. The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust and will soften during the day. On sunny slopes no snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Further warming. The weather will be exceptionally warm.
